intro: [WRONG START] Mikania lawrencei, commonly known as the creeping morning glory, is a vigorous vine native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant is known for its rapid growth and ability to climb or trail along surfaces, making it a common ornamental and invasive species. Its stems are hairy and often have a reddish tinge, while the flowers emit a mild fragrance. Mikania lawrencei is adapted to thrive in moist, well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade conditions.
